page.title: 03Adams Grammar School Newport
page.content: This{historic building}has been under attack from the Shropshire County council because they want each child to have the same{education.}The Adams{ {Grammar School}is found in Lower Bar and dates from 1656.This building is an attractive focal point of central Newport.The founder of the school William Adams was a member of the London company of Haberdashers who have the majority membership on the school governing body.About 400 boys aged 11-19 attend the school after a selection examination.(275 day pupils ,125 fee-paying{boarders}).There is a large sixth form of 90 boys.Senior{ {boarders}are housed on the one side of the high street.Junior boys stay at Longford hall. In July 1985 the governors of the Adams Grammar school plan to re-name the school to 'Haberdashers' Adams' Grammar School.
